IShader

Defines the public interface for using CShader

Module

import Rendering.Caustic.IShader;

Functions
Clone
virtual CRefObj<IShader> Clone(
ID3D11Device* 
pDevice
) = 0

Clones the shader. This is useful when you want to reuse a shader (such as those returned by IShaderMgr::FindShader) but want the shader to have its own set of parameters.

Parameters
pDevice
ID3D11Device*

device

Returns

Copy of shader

Name
virtual std::wstring &Name() = 0
Returns

Name of shader

*
pRenderer,
IRenderMaterial 
*
pMaterial,
std::
vector<CRefObj<ILight>> 
&
lights,
DirectX::
XMMATRIX 
*
pWorld
) = 0

Starts rendering.

Parameters
pRenderer
IRenderer*

graphics device

pFrontMaterial

material to use for front faces

pBackMaterial

material to use for back faces

lights
std::vector<CRefObj<ILight>>&

list of lights to use

pWorld
DirectX::XMMATRIX*

matrix to apply

EndRender
virtual void EndRender(
IRenderer* 
pRenderer
) = 0

Ends rendering. Called after the rendering using the shader has completed.

Parameters
pRenderer
IRenderer*

graphics device

GetShaderInfo

Returns

Dispatch
virtual void Dispatch(
IRenderer* 
pRenderer,
int 
xThreads,
int 
yThreads,
int 
zThreads
) = 0

This runs the compute shader, if any.

Parameters
pRenderer
IRenderer*

graphics device

int

Number of threads in Y axis
